transportAdvice: Rhodes Town's Old City and waterfront are very walkable, and public buses connect the main towns and beach resorts across the island reasonably well. Taxis are widely available, and renting a car or scooter is a popular option for exploring more remote areas.

weather.description: Cool and occasionally rainy with mild temperatures; the island is quiet and uncrowded.
Similar to January with frequent overcast skies and some rain, though sunny spells do occur.
Early spring brings warmer days and decreasing rainfall, making it pleasant for sightseeing.
Warm and mostly sunny with comfortable temperatures ideal for exploring the island.
Reliably sunny and warm; a great time to visit before the peak summer crowds arrive.
Hot and almost entirely dry with long sunny days and a refreshing sea breeze.
Peak summer heat with intense sunshine; beaches are busy and evenings are warm.
Very hot and dry, similar to July; the Meltemi wind can provide some relief from the heat.
Warm and mostly sunny with the sea still very warm; crowds begin to thin out.
Pleasant autumn temperatures with occasional showers; a relaxed and quieter time to visit.
Noticeably cooler with increasing rain; most tourist facilities begin to close for the season.
Cool and wet with a quiet, off-season atmosphere; the Old Town retains its charm year-round.
